definition: (in the negative) (not) to be trifled with
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
lifetime/generation/group of people/class/classifier for generations/(literary) classifier for people

sentences.english: Quintana is a crafty southpaw with good skills and is by no means a walk - over.
sentences.chinese: 昆塔纳是个技术出色的狡猾的左撇子，绝非等闲之辈。

sentences.english: Being lucky can turn over to open this volume, in usually persons eye all definitely not of no importance.
sentences.chinese: 有幸能翻开本册者，在寻常人眼里都决非等闲之辈。

sentences.english: I've found that he is by no means ordinary.
sentences.chinese: 我发现他绝非等闲之辈。

sentences.english: He's nobody here in town but I suppose he's a somebody in his own village.
sentences.chinese: 他在城里默默无闻，我想他在本村却非等闲之辈。

sentences.english: The names mentioned on the cables are political veterans, not just any Tom, Dick, or Harry.
sentences.chinese: 电报引述的人物都是政坛翘楚，皆非等闲之辈。

sentences.english: Confucius awoke and knew his compatriot was not an ordinary person.
sentences.chinese: 孔子这时才惊醒过来，知道这位老乡，实非等闲之辈。

definition: sb who is easy to deal with
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
to belittle/to look down upon/to despise
out of the ordinary/out of the common run
